p: Therefore, it is urgent to develop a technique that is of high response, low limit of detection, simplicity in operation and capability of in situ detection. There are a few of techniques to detect heavy metal ions, such as atomic absorption spectroscopy (AAS) [ 17], inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS) [ 18] and fluorescence spectroscopy (FS) [ 19, 20]. The quantum dot (QD) method, with grain size less than 5 nm, has fluorescence effects, which could be used in the detection of drugs [ 21], anions [ 22] and organic pollutants [ 23]. It also has prospects in the detection of heavy metal ions by using its characteristics of fluorescence.
